column1: *Add phase data at the bottom of this sheet.
*When you finish editing, save the sheet as a CSV file.
*(Lines starting with an asterisk are regarded as comments.)
*The data file format version and drawing conditions are written below.
*You can also change these settings when you create diagrams with Chesta.
*The data file format version is written here. You don't need to change it from '3'.
*Specify the dimension of this data file.
*Specify temperature at which thermodynamic data are given.
*Specify axis types in sequence. log activity -> 'loga'  -log activity -> 'pL'  Energy[kJ] -> 'kJ'  Energy[eV] -> 'eV'  Potential[V] -> 'E'
*Specify phase names corresponding to each axis.
*Specify lower limits of each axis in sequence.
*Specify upper limits of each axis in sequence.
*Specify whether the data file supports the temperature change feature or not.
*'0' -> No   '1' -> Yes (Entropies are given.)   '2' -> Yes(Enthalpies are given.)
*Thermodynamic data of the phases in the system are written below.
*Data of each phase are written in a line.
*Think of the reaction formula for the formation of each phase (from the phases of the axes).
*Prepare standard Gibbs free energy change (kJ/mol) for the reaction.
*Then write the phase name, coefficients on the left-hand side of the reaction formula, standard Gibbs free energy change (kJ/mol), and log activity shift d(log a) (normally 0) in sequence.
*Add phases which belong to the system below.
*From "The NBS tables of chemical thrmodynamic properties"
